Package pulse.problem.schemes

Class DiscretePulse

  • java.lang.Object
    • pulse.problem.schemes.DiscretePulse
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiscretePulse2D
    public class DiscretePulse
extends java.lang.Object
    A DiscretePulse is an object that acts as a medium between the physical Pulse and the respective DifferenceScheme used to process the solution of a Problem.
    See Also:
    Pulse

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DiscretePulse​(Problem problem, Pulse pulse, Grid grid)
      This creates a one-dimensional discrete pulse on a grid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiscretePulse

        public DiscretePulse​(Problem problem,
                     Pulse pulse,
                     Grid grid)
        This creates a one-dimensional discrete pulse on a grid.

        The dimensional factor is taken from the problem, while the discrete pulse width (a multiplier of the grid parameter tau is calculated using the gridTime method.

        Parameters:
        problem - the problem, used to extract the dimensional time factor
        pulse - the physical (continuous) pulse
        grid - a grid used to discretise the pulse

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateAt

        public double evaluateAt​(double time)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This evaluates the dimensionless, discretised pulse function on a grid based on the type of the PulseShape. It is then used to evaluate the heat source in the difference scheme.
        Parameters:
        time - the dimensionless time (a multiplier of tau), at which calculation should be performed
        Returns:
        a double value, representing the pulse function at time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the PulseShape is unknown

      • recalculate

        public void recalculate()
        Recalculates the discretePulseWidth by calling gridTime on the physical pulse width and timeFactor.

      • optimise

        public void optimise​(Grid grid)
        Optimises the grid parameters.

        This can change the tauFactor and tau variables in the grid object if discretePulseWidth < grid.tau.

        Parameters:
        grid - the grid to be adjusted

      • getDiscretePulseWidth

        public double getDiscretePulseWidth()
        Gets the discrete pulse width defined by DiscretePulse.
        Returns:
        a double, representing the discrete pulse width.

      • getPulse

        public Pulse getPulse()
        Gets the physical Pulse
        Returns:
        the Pulse object

      • getGrid

        public Grid getGrid()
        Gets the Grid object used to construct this DiscretePulse
        Returns:
        the Grid object.
